comments.body: Test case that describes this behavior and explains why it exists (so if someone breaks it they won't blindly change the test.

I still don't understand why we're adding a UUID field to the _manifest_ only. If we're making a UUID field in addition to our current ID field, it should go in JSONBase. But then one wonders what our current ID field is doing.

TL;DR - The state of the world is a bit messed up.  Until we fix that, we
need something.

On Sun, Sep 7, 2014 at 11:09 PM, Daniel Smith notifications@github.com
wrote:

Today existing ID field is used as Name, but not required. If it is absent, the system automatically generates a UUID for it. UUID I added is truly UUID, and required and uniquest in both space and timing.
Add a unittest to make sure UUID is set to manifest.
